title: 109_s3000
content: The Act may be cited as the "Copper Valley Native Allotment Resolution Act of 2006". It includes definitions for clarity. The Act defines the term "Association" as Copper Valley Electric Association and "Native allotment" as specific allotments issued under the Act of May 17, 1906. The term "Native allotment" includes specific allotments issued under the Act of May 17, 1906, excluding those with approved rights of way or patents. The term "Native allotment" includes specific allotments issued under the Act of May 17, 1906, excluding those with approved rights of way or patents. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and "State" refers to the State of Alaska. SEC. 3. ELECTRIC TRANSMISSION LINE RIGHTS-OF-WAY. Rights-of-way are granted to the Association across Native allotments for an electric transmission line. The Secretary determines the accurate legal description and widths of the rights-of-way. Existing electric transmission rights-of-ways are ratified, except for certain agreements. The Act does not apply to land owned by Ahtna, Inc. or existing right-of-way agreements with Copper Valley Electric Association or the State. The Secretary will appraise and compensate owners of Native allotments for granting rights-of-way, issue location instruments, and provide written notice of compensation. The Act excludes land owned by Ahtna, Inc. or covered by existing right-of-way agreements. The Secretary will appraise and compensate owners of Native allotments for granting rights-of-way, issue location instruments, and provide written notice of compensation procedures. The Secretary will determine compensation for Native allotments encumbered by a right-of-way based on an appraisal conducted in accordance with federal land acquisition standards. The compensation payments for Native allotments encumbered by a right-of-way will be based on an appraisal conducted according to federal land acquisition standards. The date of valuation for the acquisition by the Association of each right-of-way will be the date they first entered the Native allotment to develop the utility line. Compensation payments will be nonreimbursable and paid from the permanent judgment appropriation under section 1304 of title 31, United States Code. Judicial review of the Secretary's determination on compensation for a right-of-way over a Native allotment is limited under title 31, United States Code. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Such sums as necessary are authorized to carry out this Act.
